description: Five years after tearfully telling a court that she'd been sexually assaulted by Harvey Weinstein, former "Project Runway" production assistant Miriam Haley took the stand again Tuesday.
title: Miriam Haley testifies against Harvey Weinstein once more

description: President Donald Trump has fired former second gentleman Doug Emhoff from the board that oversees the Holocaust Museum.
title: Trump fires Doug Emhoff and other Biden appointees from Holocaust Museum board

description: In recent months, a group of researchers conducted a secret experiment on Reddit to see how artificial intelligence can be used to influence human opinion.
title: Researchers secretly infiltrated a popular Reddit forum with AI bots, causing outrage

description: Trump announced a new series of fighter jets for the Selfridge Air National Guard base in Michigan, giving credit in part to Democratic Gov. Gretchen Whitmer.
title: Trump praises Gov. Gretchen Whitmer while announcing new fighter jets for a Michigan air base

description: In today’s edition, we break down four sets of data that explain President Donald Trump’s first 100 days in office.
title: The story of Trump's first 100 days in 4 charts: From the Politics Desk

description: Immigration and Customs Enforcement has indicated they could start terminating a person’s legal status because of visa revocation.
title: Visa revocations can now lead to legal status terminations, according to internal memo

description: Rep. Gerry Connolly's decision to step down from the Oversight Committee could spark a battle between old-guard Democrats and younger progressives.
title: House Democrats jockey behind the scenes to become party's top investigator of Trump administration

description: The American wife of Alfredo Linares, who came to the U.S. from Mexico when he was a teen and is undocumented, said she didn't want to risk her husband being sent away.
title: Mixed status LA couple self-deports, fearing husband's detention

description: Harvard University is promising to review its academic offerings and admissions policies in response to a pair of internal reports on antisemitism and anti-Arab prejudice at the Ivy League campus commissioned in the aftermath of last spring’s pro-Palestinian protests.
title: Harvard pledges reforms following internal reports on antisemitism and anti-Arab bias

description: A Democratic lawmaker in Michigan has gotten a bad "wrap" after pulling a prank on a Republican colleague who she said had parked in her spot.
title: Michigan lawmaker penalized after covering Republican colleague's car in plastic wrap

description: The four girls who were killed Monday in a crash at a school camp program in Illinois have been identified by the county coroner's office.
title: 4 girls killed in Illinois after-school program crash are identified

description: President Donald Trump wants the oil and gas industry to “drill, baby, drill” in pursuit of his energy dominance agenda, but the companies involved in the actual drilling and servicing of wells have instead taken a beating during his first 100 days in office.
title: Oil industry that Trump wants to 'drill, baby, drill' has taken a beating since he took office

description: Jordon Hudson, who drew attention after a CBS interview with her boyfriend, former NFL coach Bill Belichick, added more intrigue with a post on Instagram.
title: Bill Belichick's girlfriend, Jordon Hudson, posts coach's email about book promotion

description: In a warming world with increasingly extreme weather events, homeowners are turning to backup batteries for relief and peace of mind.
title: Why homebuilder Lennar is betting on a startup building backup batteries for Texas homes

description: WASHINGTON — Ed Martin, President Donald Trump's nominee to lead the Office of the Attorney General for the District of Columbia on a permanent basis, dodged questions about his views on Jan. 6 and his prior criticism of Republican politicians in written answers to the Senate Judiciary Committee as part of his confirmation process.
title: Trump pick for key prosecutor post dodges Senate questions on Jan. 6, criticism of GOP members

description: Trump has moved with remarkable speed in his first 100 days, issuing more than 100 executive orders and pushing an agenda that has the potential to rapidly remake America.
title: Here's what Trump has done on 14 of his major campaign promises

description: JetBlue Airways is getting ready to announce a partnership with another U.S. airline with a larger network in the coming weeks, the carrier’s president said Tuesday.
title: JetBlue to partner with another U.S. airline in the coming weeks

description: The owner of an Idaho bar and restaurant plans to host a two-day “Hetero Awesome Fest” outside of the state Capitol in Boise in June to coincide with LGBTQ Pride Month.
title: 'Hetero Awesome Fest' planned for Idaho capitol during LGBTQ Pride Month

description: A new private membership club in Washington, D.C., co-founded by Donald Trump Jr., is charging a $500,000 membership fee — and there’s already a waiting list.
title: Donald Trump Jr. co-founds new private members club, Executive Branch, with a $500,000 fee

description: Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla on Tuesday said uncertainty around President Donald Trump’s planned pharmaceutical tariffs is deterring the company from further investing in U.S. manufacturing and research and development.
title: Pfizer CEO says tariff uncertainty is deterring further U.S. investment in manufacturing, R&D

description: WASHINGTON — Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said Tuesday that he will move to end a Department of Defense program for women created during and promoted by the first Trump administration.
title: Pete Hegseth says he will end a Trump-backed Pentagon program for women

description: Watch live coverage as President Trump delivers remarks to the Michigan National Guard on his 100th day in office. This is the president's first time in the battleground state since his win in November.
title: Trump delivers remarks to Michigan National Guard on 100th day in office

description: Lawmakers in Florida gave final passage to a bill banning fluoride in public water systems on Tuesday, with the state House voting 88 yay and 27 nay.
title: Florida set to become second state to ban fluoride in public water

description: The owner of a Pittsburgh pet mortuary faces charges after allegedly victimizing thousands of grieving customers by carelessly dumping their deceased four-legged loved ones into landfills and giving them ashes of other animals, authorities said Monday.
title: Pittsburgh mortuary owner accused of dumping pets' remains in landfill

description: George Kittle agreed to a four-year contract extension with the San Francisco 49ers that will make him the highest-paid tight end in NFL history.
title: 49ers make George Kittle the highest-paid tight end in NFL history with $76.4 million deal

description: Actor Terrence Howard revealed that he refused to portray Marvin Gaye in potential film because of the Motown singer's rumored homosexuality, saying he'd cut his lips off if he ever kissed a man. The former "Empire" star made the confession during a nearly two-hour appearance on Bill Maher's "Club Random" podcast.
title: Terrence Howard refused Marvin Gaye role over prospect of kissing a man, says 'I would cut my lips off'

description: HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is planning a $20 million ad campaign amid sweeping budget cuts that could include eliminating 10,000 jobs and several divisions.
title: RFK Jr. planning $20 million HHS 'Take Back Your Health' ad campaign

description: Thousands of Haitians refugees could be forced back to a country dealing with vast gang violence if a judge clears the runway for Trump to end a humanitarian probation program.
title: Haitians who fled mass violence await judge's decision on Trump's deportation order

description: Beyoncé brought the rodeo to Los Angeles on Monday for the opening night of her Cowboy Carter Tour, with a flying red convertible, mechanical bull riding, a prop big rig — and appearances by daughters Blue Ivy and Rumi Carter.
title: Beyoncé kicks off Cowboy Carter Tour with daughters Blue Ivy and Rumi

description: In his first comments to the media since his April 14 detainment during his naturalization interview in Vermont, Columbia student Mohsen Mahdawi says he has faith that he won't be deported.
title: Mohsen Mahdawi speaks out for first time from detention: 'I have faith that justice will prevail'

description: A man who worked for a prominent German far-right lawmaker in the European Parliament has been charged with spying for China.
title: Former aide to far-right German lawmaker charged with spying for China

description: Several artifacts are being removed from the National Museum of African American History and Culture, according to the owners of the artifacts.
title: Some artifacts removed from African American history museum after executive order

description: Amazon on Tuesday said that it had considered listing tariff charges on Amazon Haul, its discount platform meant to compete with low-cost Chinese e-commerce companies like Temu and Shein, but has decided against it.
title: Amazon says it won't list tariff charges on ultracheap Haul site after White House calls idea 'hostile'

description: A Yale study shows that despite medical advancements, life expectancy in some states, especially in the South, hasn't improved much in 100 years, particularly for women.
title: Life expectancy for women in some Southern states has barely budged in more than 100 years

description: The Trump administration said the University of Pennsylvania violated laws guaranteeing women equal opportunities in athletics by letting a transgender swimmer compete on the school’s women’s team and into team facilities.
title: Trump administration says Penn violated sex discrimination laws after trans swimmer competed

description: Video released by police shows the moment a recreational boat crashed into the back of a ferry in Clearwater, Florida, killing one person and injuring 10 others.
title: Video shows moment boat crashes into Florida ferry, killing 1 person and injuring 10 others

description: U.S. automakers are set to get a break on some of the sweeping tariffs President Donald Trump is imposing.
title: Automakers to get a break on some Trump tariffs — but the outlook for the 'Big 3' is still cloudy

description: A man arrested on suspicion of manslaughter following the death of ice hockey player Adam Johnson has been told he will not face any charges, British prosecutors said Tuesday.
title: Man arrested after death of hockey player Adam Johnson won't face charges

description: Women who survive cancer are more likely to experience cancer-related fatigue and depression than men, according to new research presented Tuesday at the American Association for Cancer Research’s annual meeting in Chicago.
title: Women who survive cancer are more likely to have fatigue and depression than men

description: Storms will wreak havoc from southern Texas to northern New York on Tuesday, bringing hazards of hail, strong winds and a few tornadoes.
title: Severe storms with rain, hail and strong winds roar from Midwest to New England

description: President Donald Trump signed a slew of executive orders hours after taking the oath of office, including declaring a national emergency on the U.S.-Mexico border, ordering construction on his border wall to resume and terminating diversity programs at federal agencies.
title: Trump 2.0: The first 100 days in photos

description: Donald Trump reaches his 100th day in office.
title: Trump marks first 100 days and Prime Minister Mark Carney wins Canada election: Morning Rundown

description: Power was mostly restored across the Iberian Peninsula Tuesday, after a massive outage hit Spain and Portugal, grounding aircrafts, and disrupting traffic.
title: The lights are back on in Spain and Portugal. Nobody knows why they went out.

description: Democratic Rep. Angie Craig announced Tuesday that she's running for the Senate in Minnesota, a long-expected campaign that sets up a crowded primary among Craig, the state's lieutenant governor and a former state legislative leader.
title: Rep. Angie Craig launches Senate run in Minnesota ahead of a competitive Democratic primary

description: It took nearly two years, and a federal lawsuit, for Wendy Tippitt to see the police video that captured the fatal shooting of her son, Timothy Michael Randall.
title: After killing unarmed man, Texas deputy told colleague: 'I just smoked a dude'

description: WASHINGTON — When Toi Cliatt heard a loud bang in his Atlanta home in the early hours of Oct.
title: Supreme Court considers lawsuit arising from 'wrong house' FBI raid

description: WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump has leaned heavily on executive power to remake the federal government at the outset of his new administration, largely leaving Congress on the sidelines.
title: Trump signs few laws as he pushes to expand executive power

description: The U.S. Navy has launched an investigation after it lost a $67 million dollar fighter jet at sea Monday while on operations in the Middle East.
title: U.S. Navy lost a $67 million fighter jet at sea after it fell off an aircraft carrier

description: Four former Hong Kong lawmakers were freed from prison after serving more than four years for their convictions under a Beijing-imposed security law.
title: 4 former Hong Kong lawmakers freed after years in prison under a Beijing-imposed security law

description: The trial of a woman accused of murdering three elderly people after serving them a lunch of poisonous mushrooms began in Australia on Tuesday.
title: Mushroom murder trial begins in rural Australia

description: While more than 55,000 unionized workers for Los Angeles County are set to strike Monday evening, county officials said there is simply no money to meet the employees’ demands.
title: Why LA County says it can’t give raises to thousands of workers set to strike

description: U.N. and Palestinian representatives at the ICJ accused Israel of breaking international law by refusing to let aid into Gaza, on the first day of hearings.
title: Israel accused of using aid as a 'weapon of war' against Gaza in World Court hearing

description: The only Black, all-female unit to serve in Europe during World War II, commonly known as the “Six Triple Eight,” will be presented Tuesday with the Congressional Gold Medal, following a long-running campaign to recognize their efforts.
title: Black female WWII unit ‘Six Triple Eight’ to receive congressional honor

description: A jaw-dropping video from Arizona captures the moment a speed boat racing at 200 miles-per-hour flips through the air and crashes. NBC News' Ryan Chandler has the story on how the drivers walked away with minor injuries.
title: High-speed boat going over 200 mph crashes, drivers survive with minor injuries

description: A Texas mother is searching for answers after her son was killed during a routine traffic stop. NBC News' Stephanie Gosk explains how the family fought for two years to see the police dashcam video and how the mother believes the video contradicts the police version of events.
title: Texas family demands answers over 2022 disputed police shooting

description: The proceedings are underway against 10 people charged in connection with the 2016 robbery in which they allegedly held Kim Kardashian at gunpoint and stole her jewelry while she was in Paris for the city's fashion week. NBC News' Chloe Melas has the details on the trial.
title: Trial begins for 10 people accused in 2016 armed heist against Kim Kardashian

description: A ground stop was issued at Newark Liberty International Airport in New Jersey due to an FAA equipment malfunction, which caused significant delays. NBC News' Morgan Chesky explains what caused the issue and its impact on travelers.
title: FAA equipment issue causes major disruptions at Newark Airport

description: Four people between the ages of 4 to 18 were killed when a vehicle struck an after school camp program in Chatham, Illinois, according to officials. NBC News' Gadi Schwartz has the details on the crash.
title: Four killed after vehicle hits after-school program site in Illinois

description: The chair of the House committee overseeing health care policy said they're looking at unwinding the federal promise to cover 90% of the 2010 law's Medicaid expansion.
title: Republicans consider unraveling a key part of Obamacare in Trump agenda bill

description: Former cybersecurity official Chris Krebs led the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency during Trump’s first term in office.
title: 'Absolutely outraged': Former cyber official targeted by Trump speaks out after cuts to U.S. digital defense

description: David Knezevich, charged in the murder and disappearance of his estranged wife Ana Maria Henao Knezevich last year, was found dead in jail, his attorney said Monday.
title: Florida man charged in wife’s murder in Spain found dead in jail

description: As Beyoncé’s Cowboy Carter tour kicks off, thousands of cheap tickets are still for sale
title: As Beyoncé’s Cowboy Carter Tour kicks off, thousands of cheap tickets are still for sale
